intro: Aureolaria flava subsp. typica, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, while its stems are often sprawling or ascending. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid environments.
